original: Magnusson, David Johan Karl, civilingenjör SVR, Göteborg, f. 14/11/98 i Gbg av Amandus M. o. Hanna Johansson. G. 1. 24 m. Ruth Karlgren, d. 32; 2. 36 m. Greta Lindeli. Barn: Britt-M,arie f. 24, ing. GTI, Ingela 28, d. 32, Anita 30, Margareta 37, Karl-Magnus 42. — Realstud :ex. i Gbg 19, utex. fr. CTH (VoV) 24. Anst. v. gatukont. i Gbg 24-35, renhåMn :ver’ket där 28, stadsing:kont. där 35-38, förste ing. v. samt chef f. Gbgs stads fastigh :kon-tors gatureg’1 :byrå sed. 38. Tillika assist, v. CTH sed. 32. Sekr. i Tekn. samf. avd. f. väg- o. vattenbyggn :-konst sed. 43. Resa ’t. FiniL, Norge, Danm., Tyskil. o. Ryssi. 34. Hobby: ■segling.
translated: Magnusson, David Johan Karl, civil engineer SVR, Gothenburg, b. 14/11/98 in Gothenburg to Amandus M. and Hanna Johansson. Married 1st in 1924 to Ruth Karlgren, deceased in 1932; 2nd in 1936 to Greta Lindeli. Children: Britt-Marie b. 1924, engineer at GTI, Ingela b. 1928, deceased in 1932, Anita b. 1930, Margareta b. 1937, Karl-Magnus b. 1942. Completed real studies in Gothenburg in 1919, graduated from CTH (VoV) in 1924. Employed at the City Street Office in Gothenburg from 1924-1935, at the Sanitation Department from 1928, at the City Engineering Office from 1935-1938, as the chief engineer and head of Gothenburg's City Property Management Office's street planning department since 1938. Also worked as an assistant at CTH since 1932. Secretary in the Technical Society, Department of Road and Water Engineering since 1943. Traveled to Finland, Norway, Denmark, Germany, and Russia in 1934. Hobby: sailing.

structured.name: David Johan Karl Magnusson

affiliation.name: Technical Society, Department of Road and Water Engineering

structured.description: David Johan Karl Magnusson was a Swedish civil engineer born on November 14, 1898, in Gothenburg. He completed his studies at Chalmers University of Technology in 1924. Throughout his career, he worked at various organizations including the City Street Office, Sanitation Department, City Engineering Office, and Gothenburg's City Property Management Office, where he served as the chief engineer and head of the street planning department from 1938. He was also affiliated with the Technical Society, Department of Road and Water Engineering, starting from 1943. David was married twice, first to Ruth Karlgren in 1924 until her death in 1932, and then to Greta Lindeli in 1936. He had five children named Britt-Marie, Ingela, Anita, Margareta, and Karl-Magnus. David had a hobby of sailing and he enjoyed traveling to Finland, Norway, Denmark, Germany, and Russia in 1934.
